caption: What a great meal! Picked it up and it was on time, fresh and warm. Food was brought to the car, which was nice considering it was freezing outside. The food was insanely good! We dont have a fav dish because it was just all so delish! Even the pickles and cashews I ordered on a whim were great! Def one of the best takeout meals we have had during Covid. Cant wait to go dine in when safe.

I do empathize with small business especially during covid, but this place has horrible food... The beef don was rotten, and "soba" in this place means instant-like noodles... with plenty of salt. Were these problems nonexistent, still pretty pricy.

Absolutely beautiful space, incredibly attentive staff, and a phenomenal dining experience. The omakase at Kikkō below the bar was an immensely flavorful sequence of foods and the drinks served alongside were equally fantastic (I ordered the cocktail pairing menu). The bar upstairs is an enjoyable experience as well. The drink menu is full of options and the staff are extremely knowledgeable about everything on it. Having already been through the cocktail pairing menu before going up to the bar, I only opted for one drink, the gin and tonic. I highly recommend trying it.

Great creative cocktail program...amazing food and service is genuine...i had the pleasure to deal with the owner and she was smiling from the start ,adapt to my request which was not in the menu ...and just make it happen with a smile ...worthy , professional ,creative ...#nextlevel

Kumiko’s to-go offerings are delightful, you can pre-order, and they will bring to your car. Which makes it very convenient  Their cocktails, snacks, teas, and matcha are all carefully packaged, which is a huge plus; we went to the Japanese garden to enjoy these and have also enjoyed them on their patio.  You can never go wrong with them!

I have been wanting to visit Kumiko for quite some time, but due to COVID I put off my hopes for the time being. I'm about 8 months sober, and my desire to go to Kumiko was to experience the beautiful spirit-free drinks. Little did I know, my mom had discovered this and decided to order the Omochi-Kaeri versions of several spirit-free drinks to surprise me for Thanksgiving. She emailed with questions and got an almost immediate response both times (even during closed business hours). The response even included a "congratulations to your daughter" about my sobriety. I was in tears when she told me. Not only were the drinks absolutely beautiful, delicious, and sophisticated (the best spirit-free I've ever experienced), but the service and kindness went even beyond that.

Expertly crafted cocktails and delicious food accompaniments. My girlfriend really loved her matcha latte. The pickled peppers and rosu-katsu were excellent (and also paired together really well). Definitely pricey but, in my opinion, worth every cent. The patio space was additionally lovely - can't wait until they're able to open up again for their omakase experience!

Food is absolutely delicious. It was a unique experience.  I definitely loved the fact vegetables are from local farmers, and would love to see more information, videos or pictures about the farm and farmers contributing to fresh food.
The multi course tasting menu at Kikko was one of the very best dining experiences I’ve had in Chicago or anywhere.   Worth the hype and Michelin star!
Amazing!!

My husband and I went to Kumiko last night, Saturday, February 15, 2020 at 8:00 p.m. For the restaurant's review, when you walk in, we sat on the right hand side, against the wall, second table away from the bar.  This was, hands down, the worst service experience I think I have ever had in Chicago (where I am from). We 100% went to this place knowing that it's the cocktail part of Kikko. However, when we spoke to someone on the phone earlier in the day, she explained that Kumiko has a separate food menu whereby you can also do your own omakase. When we sat down, the server came over to us and immediately began speaking to us in a condescending manner that was, off-the-bat, off putting. The way he  explained what we were able to eat there was extremely aggressive to the point where I felt I had to interrupt him to explain that we have been all over the world to omakase restaurants, including Jiro, to give him the idea that we didn't appreciate the arrogant tone. He proceeded to make inappropriate comments to us like, "You can have drinks, but not too many, because my goal is to not lose our liquor license."  When he walked away, I still felt as though he did not explain what Kumiko's omakase menu entailed. Therefore, my husband and I decided to just order whatever individual items we wanted from the menu. The server came back over to our table, and at the same time, the man to my husband's left waved the server over to his table as well. Considering the server approached our table first, the man to my husband's left waited patiently (very nice) to be taken care of next. My husband asked the server if he was ready to which he responded yes, so he, therefore, started listing off numerous items for our order. About 4 items in, the server literally put his open palm hand up to my husband's face and said, "Hold on." He walked around my husband's back to the man to my husband's left and goes, "What can I get for you? Would you like to order a drink?" He actually stopped my husband in the middle of his order to take someone else's order that he deemed to be more important. We were disgusted and shocked that that just happened. When this server returned, I told him nevermind, and we just wanted our two drinks we ordered. My husband and I immediately decided that we wanted to get the hell out of there, drink our drinks, and go get food at a more reputable spot in West Loop (to which we did). When the server asked us, again, if we still wanted to place a food order, I told him no and that we were going to eat somewhere else. He asked us where, and then proceeded to tell us how to get there.  I actually have no idea how someone like this could be working at a place that is supposed to be associated with a Michelin rating. My husband and I are not frugal when it comes to eating out and eating good food. We were well aware that ordering off that menu was going to be a few hundred dollars, and we were fine with it until we were completed disrespected like nothing we have ever seen before. I actually felt like this was a Julia Roberts moment because we walked out and spent our money at another well known sushi spot in West Loop. My point of this review is not to get anything comped as we will never step foot in this place ever again. I just hope that this review brings attention to whatever management team Kumiko has so that they can take appropriate actions to make sure this never happens to anyone again. I have told this story about the server's hand in my husband's face numerous times since last night, and everyone's mouths drop when they hear about it.  To the management, if you want to speak further, please contact me directly.

An absolutely amazing experience. Kumiko stands out with it's amazing ambiance, warmth, and wonderful bites. Every piece feels unique, artful, elegant, and delicious. Eating at Kumiko is like a little symphony for you eyes and mouth. Few restaurants feel and smell as homey and cozy as this.
Great drinks, service and presentation.

Kumiko is much more than going out for drinks. Kumiko is an experience. From the time you walk into the gentle incense infused foyer, to the service, and drinks, and snacks. To the time you even decide to leave. Everything and everyone at Kumiko is Next Level. The atmosphere is quaint, and friendly and upscale with a Japanese flair that could’ve been uplifted from the Tokyo suburbs if it weren’t for the Green Line tracks outside. Bernard was our “host” because there are no mere servers at Kumiko. And the welcome we got from him and the rest of the team was simply amazing. He took the time to thoroughly explain all the drink options and delve into more detail of our choices. The expertly mixed drinks from the bartender were fantastic, as well as the snacks they offer, so you don’t get too sauced. There are several small food bite items that you simply must try. The staff will help guide you with your tastes and what would go best. When we were ready to leave, the Kumiko team, and I must emphasize team, since they all  worked so seamlessly, must have timed this out as well, since our coats were ready and waiting for us by the door, in the hostess’s hands.  If you’re looking for a great little night out with someone special, or even flying solo but have a serious interest and palette for the unique, visit Kumiko. You will not forget it. I cannot wait for my next visit.

Delicious cocktails filled with spirits and ingredients you have never heard of before. Some of the best service you will EVER experience, a real team. Talk to the staff and ask questions!! Impressive date night drinks and can’t wait to come back. Bonus points for the amazing smells and cleanest restaurant bathroom ever.

It's hard to describe an experience like this as an "average Jane" because you feel like royalty. It is expensive no doubt but worth every single penny. Impeccable service, insanely delicious, creative cocktails, tiny bites of delectable delicacies, a pen flashlight to read the menu.. I enjoyed every second. My husband & I went for my birthday & wanted to try everything! Needless to say we'll be back as often as possible! The hostess greeted us in the unique & beautiful space with a hot sip of green tea  & proceeded to take our winter coats. It was a special touch with the tea. For drinks we had, Walk Softly, Seamless, Triptych, Hidden Truth & the mezcal cocktail which the name escapes me. We also had the Niigata Sake Flight. By far Hidden Truth is the best cocktail with it's savory notes of chili oil & togarashi & citrus tang bite in the sip. Unforgettable. For food we enjoyed the, Nigiri, Sashimi, Oyster, Prawn & Shiitake Steam Buns. (Several of the latter two!) It's my new favorite thing in Chicago. Not even bar or restaurant. Just, thing. Can't wait to try Kikko next!

It's daunting to begin a review for one of the best cocktail programs I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing in my whole entire life. Kumiko is that good. Here goes nothing...  My friend and I were traveling to Chicago in mid-December when Kumiko popped up in my last-minute frenzy of searching for can't miss cocktails bars in the city. If you need more than just my word for how amazing Kumiko is, it made Bon Appetit's Hot 50 list and landed on Time Magazine's world's greatest places list for 2019.  My friend and I *love* Japanese cuisine and cocktails (so much so that we've gone to many cocktail bars across Japan), so we desperately wanted to make it to Kumiko while in Chicago. However, we too late to make a reservation for 2 online. I emailed the restaurant to explain our situation and we were encouraged to try walking in around 5:00/5:30 p.m. to get a spot at the bar. We were in luck because we got there at 5:30 p.m. and we only have to wait 8 minutes (yes, it was that precise of an estimate) to get a spot. It was a Wednesday night when we went though, so if you attempt this on a Friday you might not be as lucky. While we waited, we were treated to a lovely cup of green tea in the waiting area by one of the hostesses.  The Kumiko space itself is gorgeous. As we were ushered into our spots at the bar, it was like you were transported to straight to a high-end cocktail bar in Tokyo. Beyond the beauty of the serene and other-worldly space, the service and cocktail program are outstanding. Julia Momose's cocktail program is something really special. You've probably tasted or heard of Japanese whiskey, but have you tried Japanese shochu, umeshu, or gin? All of this is possible at Kumiko. Our bartender for the evening, Sammy, was super personable, friendly, helpful at directing us towards the right drinks when we were in-between two beverages. We had a genuinely fun evening chatting with Sammy at the bar and we wished we didn't have dinner reservations to run off to after. My favorite drink of the night was the Hidden Truth which was made with lemongrass shochu, lemon, togarashi syrup, and chili oil. If I could drink this every day throughout winter I would. The heat from the chili oil was divine. My next favorite was Sunshine Follows which has gin, sake, chrysanthemum honey, lemon, and pink peppercorn. It was crisp, bright, and refreshing.  You're looking at roughly $20 a cocktail and I had no regrets. If I lived in Chicago, I would make the effort to come here multiple times a year. In my wildest dreams, I would love to be a regular. Ultimately, whether you're traveling through Chicago, or a local, you should absolutely make it a point to grab drinks at Kumiko. The next time I'm in town there is no question in my mind that I'll be returning for more drinks, and to try out their food menu.

Utterly blew my mind. I heard that the cocktails were good... I was not prepared. The cocktails were just as good as Death & Co, Bathtub Gin, Attaboy... Name any top cocktail bar.  But what set them apart was the service. We sat at the bar and the bartender was friendly and warm, but formal. He had the perfect balance of talking to us and letting us be. When I dropped my phone he came from behind the bar to hand it to me before I could reach down and grab it. There wasn't a drop of water on his work station and everything he used was carefully put back into its place.  This is zen as a bar and you can't miss it.
Every dish we had was incredible, the service was personal, the wait staff was attentive, and I still daydream about the milk toast.

Our experience at Kumiko was fun but not filling. I did not realize before we went that it was more of a bar and less of a restaurant. We arrived a few minutes after our reserved time, but our table was not ready either. The host suggests we either go to the bar (there was only one seat available) or go somewhere else and come back in 15 minutes (which is the strangest thing I'd ever heard of). We wait by the bar and a server pours us a couple glasses of water that sits at the window ledge. I feel awkward standing there in the small space as we feel as if we're staring at everyone seated. After about 15 minutes we are finally seated.  The menu reads from light to heavy as far as the beverage options, cocktails, flights, etc. Granted we were starving, I skip to to the back page where there are 10 bite options and a bite dessert. When I tell you it's a bite, I am telling you they are literally "one bite" except for the Katsu (4 pieces). When we alert them of my severe hot pepper allergy, I realize we might be headed to Portillo's afterwards. lol There are only able to accommodate me with about 4 of their dishes, since most already have peppers or a sauce with peppers already prepared. For $44, I was able to enjoy 4 "one bites" and a dessert we shared.  Come here for the JapaneseSake or Whiskey experience, not for the food. The notes were tasty enough, but nowhere near enough to be satisfied for dinner.  I had two "one bites" of nigiri (Shio koji-aged made with white sturgeon caviar). The fish was delicately tasty. Not worth the $20.  The sashimi of ora king salmon, torched lardo, sea grape and toasted genmai offered a texturally pleasing bite (2 bites here, whoa watch out lol), the salmon was rich in flavor and the genmai a welcoming crunch. I was able to have the steam bun with short rib without the sauce it comes with but the addition of pickled cucumber. Nicely cooked short rib, the buns were a little flat for my liking. The milk bread was a piece of soggy brioche toast, and the ice cream was mostly melty.  The Niigata Sake flight was the highlight, and for that reason I would come back. It's not their fault I didn't read the reviews to realize it was more of a bar. After all, I don't go to The Aviary to fill up. haha
Wow

The proof is in the pudding, or steamed buns and Japanese whiskey in this case.  My wife and I visited Kumiko for dinner last night in downtown Chicago and were shown why they were awarded a Michelin star.  The Drink....Tokie Highball.  A Japanese whiskey with 2 different club sodas.  Refreshing, sweet with a little kick on the first sip.  My wife had a puffed rice tea.  She said it was great.  The food....steamed buns, prawns, sweetbreads, and short rib(Gyudon).  Every bite we took was amazing and every plate we gave back was empty.  It was just the right amount of great food, a great cocktail, great service, great ambience, and a beautiful date.  Thanks to Alberto our server for walking us thru our first time and making the experience seamless and enjoyable.  We will be back again....unless they have a Kumiko Phoenix in our future.  Great Job Chefs.

Kumiko is absolute perfection. The cozy ambiance, interesting cocktails, and the top-notch service make you not want to leave. Alberto, the host, took the experience to the next level. I will go back for the drinks for sure, but also to experience Alberto’s hospitality again. Please do yourselves a favor and go check this place out.

Let’s start by saying everything we drank and ate here was exquisite and the service was kind, attentive, and knowledgeable. So why only 4 stars?  Because Kumiko makes so many things much more difficult than they need be. Most importantly, ordering. The menu is very detailed but has so many ingredients we didn’t know that our server basically had to choose our drink for us, and we heard this happening all over the dining room. A glossary or more descriptions would help lots. The other reason ordering is so tough is the lighting- it is impossible to read the small lettering in the very, very dim light. They clearly know this b/c they have pen lights to offer, but they honestly don’t help. The people around us were commenting on their own exact struggle.  Also Kumiko really doesn’t seem to know what it is. If it’s a cocktail bar, it shouldn’t be set up like a restaurant. If it’s a restaurant, there should be more substantial food choices. 2 more things - our server suggested a drink to me that was off menu, and it was fantastic, but it was also $27. Just tell me that before I order. And, finally, put a sign on your restaurant and a sign on the restroom. Your staff ends up having to work way too hard explaining and describing things that should be self-explanatory.

This is the chef bar with an omakase. The service and presentation we're good. Food were salty, especially too much soy sauce covering the taste of Uni (see picture). While the beef don looked good but there was also lot of soy sauce in the rice. Sushi were average and rice too big.

This review is for Kikko.  Minimalist perfection. Kikko takes high quality ingredients and unique spirits to give you that perfect bite and sip. The ambiance is hip yet relaxing, and the service is impeccable. Generally I sway towards a lot of moving parts with my tasting menu's and cocktails, but the appearance of simplicity at Kikko is on a whole new level. The cost is on the high end when compared to other Chicago tasting menus/pairings when you really break down the amount of food/beverage you actually receive, but luckily they have Kumiko upstairs to give you a little taste until the next time I can make it back to Kikko.
Cool space. Very nice sake selection. Seems like more of a place to grab drinks, the food was ok, not commensurate with the prices. The short ribs were a standout however.
Kumiko offers an array of excellent services. The food, the drinks, and the staff were all incredible.

Beautiful zen like atmosphere with unusual, artisanal quality cocktails.  The details from  how the ice is hand chipped for certain cocktails to the stunning mocktails for those who can't or don't wish to imbibe is flawless.  Perfect for small groups, couples.  Julia and her husband along with her staff are lovely.  If you are looking for a loud, party type atmosphere this isn't for you. This Seattlite has visited twice and will be back.  Absolutely a must for people who appreciate Japanese culture.  I hear the food is wonderful too.

There's something so special about Kumiko. Everything seems extremely thought out for its customers to have an extraordinary experience. When you come into the entrance, wait for your table or seat at the bar with a cup of hot tea,  you are transformed from the hustle and bustle of normal life to somewhere special, serene, beautiful and delicious. I absolutely love coming here, even if it's only for one incredible cocktail or glass of sake. But it's even better when you can pair your beverage with Kumiko's amazing food.

So, I accidentally made reservations for the upstairs when I intended to reserve the omakase tasting menu downstairs. So, I recommend calling in to make sure you reserve the experience that you want. Both are excellent but both are very different! After our upstairs experience we made reservations with the host for downstairs, so I have successfully enjoyed both!  Kumiko: Drinks and small bite menu. You can make it a tasting menu if you order the entire thing, we ordered nearly everything. All very delicious. What stood out for me were the steam buns, the rib dish and the sushi you wrapped yourself. Delish! Also, I very much enjoyed my drink flight, where I ordered a cocktail and 2 smaller glasses accompanied it with 2 of the Ingredients. An experiential cocktail!  Service is also excellent. Top notch servers and a cozy, classy environment.

This place earned a Michelin star 2 weeks after our visit and it's no surprise. The drinks were amazing and we'll thought out. The food is an experience that I cannot describe to give it justice. Just go.
Great food and experience
Try this. Excellent food, drink, and service!
Creative cocktails. Happened to be there on the night they received a Michelin and they shared their Moet with us. Will always come back to this place.
Ate at Kikko, the omakase bar in the basement and the food and the experience were both sublime. A real treat.
Well designed cocktails, attentive staff, and a sophisticated atmosphere make Kumiko the ideal spot for an elegant date or business drinks.
Incredible cocktails & service! From the moment you walk-in this place is next level & I can't wait to go back.
What an incredible experience. If you want authentic Japanese spirits and sake, fantastic izakaya style small plates coupled with a true midwestern hospitality, this is gonna be your go to spot.

Everything is carefully crafted, beginning with the complimentary cold tea they offered me when I arrived. I found the Ground’s Keeper cocktail much better than the New Wave. Food-wise, the prawn and the chicken liver were awesome.  4 stars because everything save the liver is extravagantly priced

Outstanding bites with standout drink pairings. The deconstructed cocktails are a must try, as is the milk bread. Sami was my bartender for the night and had amazing stories to share. A great night out!
Outstanding in every regard!
Amazing cocktails. The decor is superb inside as well

ambiance is amazing, great place to grab a quiet cocktail our server was very kind and very knowledgeable  i got the Legent Manhattan, which was smooth, sweet, and delicious my wife got the Old Fashioned, which was smokier than i prefer, but she really liked it....the ice cube in her drink was impressive!

Amazing! You MUST try the Japanese Milk Bread dessert. It was the icing on the cake to an exceptional experience from the front door through the entire service. I will definitely recommend to everyone I know. Thank you!!
Very good restaurant!! Everything we got was delicious and the cocktails are unique and hard to go wrong. The bar was beautiful too honestly.
OMG...this is a can't miss place!  Food is outstanding as are the cocktails!

Lovely atmosphere and terrific service. Food was excellent but the drinks options are not only fab they are what put Julia Momose front and center on the national food scene for her outstanding mixology skills
Cocktails are a level above even the better cocktails in Chicago.  Service is fantastic.
5+ page cocktail menu. Light bites.

We had the omakase and it did not disappoint. Service was fantastic and the food was divine. My only complaint was it was a quite warm in the basement bar where we ate. Very pricey but it was a special occasion.
Great tasting room experience!
What a fantastic experience!  We did the omakase cocktail and food pairings. So creative!  We are still talking about the magic! It was a great start the weekend in the city.

The Omakase is an incredibly bespoke and outstanding experience from top to bottom. We stayed an additional hour at the bar to sample the rest of the menu and continue enjoying the custom cocktails and unique sake. I can't recall another dinner where the drinks were hand crafted to my spirit and flavor profile preference and then perfectly paired with each bite. The New Zealand salmon and mackerel dishes are still fresh in my mind and will be coming back for them again soon.

The attention to detail that Jean George’s and Per Se once were known for (before their reputations overcame the service, and certainly any value) is what Kumiko harkens back to  - pairing great taste with an incredibly unique experience. Delicious, delectable small courses are paired perfectly with drinks that don’t exist and haven’t been imagined elsewhere. The drinks, which are catered to each guest and vary by patron’s taste and wishes (and ingredient seasonality) do not disappoint, and their flavors are accompanied with a deep knowledge of the history of their brewers/distillers/vintners and their respective origins. From glassware selection to the delightful smell and texture of the bathroom soap, everything at Kumiko is deliberate and delightful. And the Warm Capital Oysters are a flavor that will linger warmly and fondly in my memory — order a 1/2 dozen of these and thank me later.
Amazing experience from when you enter to the final drink/course. Would highly recommend. Favorite dining experience in Chicago.
Amazing.
Great first experience. Blown away by the few items that we had. I am excited to go back and try it properly. Service and food were equally good.
Julie is the best!
Delicious small plates & excellent cocktails...we'll definitely be back!
Amazing cocktails, amazing service as well

We stopped in for a few cocktails before dinner.  We were served an amazing welcome cup of tea to start. I wish I could have had more.  Our server was incredible. Super passionate about the offerings on the menu and extremely helpful.  The decor and atmosphere is worth a visit alone. The fantastic cocktails complete the package.  Can’t recommend a visit enough and can’t wait to come back to try more.

Cocktail after cocktail, this place is AhMaZing!  The service is impeccable.  If you truly want to impress or be impressed, I would undoubtedly come here for what is called an EXPERIENCE!  Warning Spoiler:  Upon arrival you are greeted by the host/hostess with a small cup of tea (I imagine it changes daily) and then escorted to the main dining/bar area.  The ambiance is a sleek and simplistic design which makes for a nice clean, crisp atmosphere. Sometimes, less is more. The menu offerings are both standard house cocktails which are quite creative as well as a seasonal menu.  I think we ordered at least 1 drink from each menu.  I recommend this place for any occasion for any type of experience, e.g., pregame, endgame or your only destination. :p
Great small dishes
A Japanese bar in Chicago ? Yes!! And a fine one at that ! The food is exceptional and drinks are curated for it. Travel worthy ; )  Get there

This brilliant new cocktail bar combines drinks from creative director Julia Momose (GreenRiver, Aviary, Oriole) and food from chef de cuisine Mariya Russell (Oriole). Also involved, of course, are Noah and Cara Sandoval from Oriole, which is almost around the corner.  Oriole earned its Michelin stars in a flash, and I wouldn’t be surprised to see some impressive awards coming to Kumiko soon, too.  As at Oriole, your first challenge is to find the place! The unmarked door is at the corner. Your experience begins with a warm greeting and a welcoming beverage (herbal tea the night I was there) at the host stand. Then you are ushered into the intimate dining room with its limited table seating and eight spots at the bar.  The atmosphere is welcoming, refined, and calming, with Japanese influenced simplicity that immediately puts you at ease.  The focus is definitely on cocktails and spirits, with an emphasis on sochu and Japanese whisky. There are also some very interesting rums, and a whole world of aperitifs and exotica.  Patrick, my bartender, was a charming host, and it was a delight watching his meticulous preparation of each drink. The main cocktail list offers a wide range of styles, so I had no trouble finding the bitter and complex flavors I favor. Patrick also helped me choose selections to match the food I ordered.  Speaking of food, the offerings are currently limited to three types of small bites (oysters, prawns, and steam buns), an eggplant dip, and two entrees (loup de mer and short rib).  I started with two of the tempura prawns, which seemed pricey at $8 each, but when they were served I realized we were in Michelin territory. They looked like something you’d find at Oriole, perfectly coated in a delicate tempura and artfully graced with yuzu, mint and edible flowers. Fabulous.  I also had the eggplant dip, which was nothing like I was expecting, but was also excellent. It was served in warm miso, and the primary flavor was of the fresh herbs–especially mint–topping it. The accompanying rice crackers were also wonderful.  My entree was the loup de mer, a delicate fish served with its crispy skin in place, and already sliced into manageable bites perfect for combining with the accompanying ponzu and bok choi. A crunchy mix of furikake (a mixture of dried fish, sesame seeds, and salt) added a great texture.  For dessert I had Japanese milk bread, which is essentially a caramelized French toast served with truffle flakes and ice cream. It was delicious.  The night I was there the omakase tasting was not available, so I wasn’t able to try that, but I’m just as glad I had a chance to explore on my own.  Because there are so many interesting spirits on offer, it’s an ideal place for people who like their drinks neat. I particularly suggest you try the El Dorado 15 year rum aged in dry Madeira casks; it’s a very complex treat.  The combination of great ambiance, perfect service, divine food, and meticulous mixology make Kumiko a winner, for sure.

This is pretty much a high scale drinks only bar. Nice discreet, low key atmosphere. Huge variety of drink selections and great service. Some reason it popped up on my search for sushi places but they don't do that.
Thoughtful, delicious, and boundary-blurring beverages; exquisite and innovative food; flawless service from beginning to end.

If you are looking for a quiet bar that pays attention to all of the details, this is your place. I came just for drinks, but the experience was delightful. The coctails were inventive and well balanced. The bartender was very thoughtful in his recommendations.

We've anticipated the opening of bar Kumiko for many months as Oriole is our favorite Chicago restaurant and we love ornate cocktails.  It certainly lived up to the hype.  The atmosphere was simple yet purposeful, the staff was friendly, the drinks we're phenomenal.  My favorite was the moonrise daquari flight, but Seamless was tasty and booze forward which no one would ever complain about. We look forward to visiting again and trying other cocktails as well.

Expected more for the price I paid. I knew this was going to be an expensive night, and I was ok with that. However, after spending $300+ including tax and tip, I left feeling I could have received a similar or better experience elsewhere. I expected a customized experience, what I received was a boilerplate set of drinks based on my preference for bourbon. The waiters barely spoke louder than the ambient noise, didn't provide any background on the drinks being served, and kept having to refer to the notes to get the drinks correct.  Their take on an old fashioned was great. I thoroughly enjoyed it, but I couldn't provide any other notable memory. I'd suggest go to the dining room, get the old fashioned and you'll have the same experience I did at a far lower cost.  Suggestions - provide more background and explanation on the drinks; I'm guessing many patrons aren't familiar with Japanese spirits. The omakase states there's "food pairings" with the drinks--these are more bites that pair well with the drinks. It is substantially less than a tasting menu. I would have scheduled this for pre-dinner drinks had I known otherwise.  I hoped a more personalized evening; I'd suggest instead go to the Milk Room at Chicago Athletic Association, similar cost but vastly better experience.

Kumiko was above all a great learning experience- how all the ingredients came together to create the perfect cocktail was true art. You have to try it once! I enjoyed both the warm note and moonrise daiquiri cocktails. The Japanese milk bread was to die for! Minus one star because I felt the seating arrangement could have been cozier and less "parallel", we were seated too close to our neighbors. Also while I enjoy great tasting cocktails, I also think presentation is important. It was pretty minimalistic, without that "wow factor" in the style drinks were served (comparing to the Aviary with quality drinks and similar prices- an average of $18/drink).
Excellent service and delicious omakase. Sake to creative cocktails perfectly paired.
Incredible space and experience. Drinks are tailored to your specific flavor profiles. The milk toast....loved!
Best Place for Fine Dine and Booze. Love the Aura here and staff is very much friendly. Food was Great and they have so much variety in drinks also. I'll surely visit this place again.
Great experience. The space is very well structured with lots of attention to detail. The cocktails and spirit frees were all excellent. The food was delicious.

The perfect place if you want to get a 15 minute description of the drink menu in order to receive a highball that tastes like a college bar well drink. Or a middling pork bun. All the while staring at the people at the omakase bar who are the only ones offered sushi. You get a choice between the three appetizer sized mains.
Great service, excellent cocktail options. The eggplant is suggested.
Outstanding! Beautiful space and excellent execution.

What a wonderful concept and experience. The service is 5 star worthy. If Michelin stars could be awarded to bars (can they?) Kumiko is well deserving. Such detail and craftsmanship goes into each unique cocktail. Also a plus for those who like to have more than one, most were lower ABV so I left feeling great and ready for more. Made an omakase reservation on our way out so I know we’ll be back!
Subtle but expertly crafted and delicious cocktails. Spiritfrees were also an unexpected highlight. Great ambiance! Would definitely love to come back and try omakase experience.

Kumiko is a singular, amazing, incredibly unique experience. Words alone can. It describe my experience there least night. From the warm greeting at the entrance to the very last moment before you leave, every last detail of your journey has been thoughtfully determined and executed with excellence. . Don’t go just because Julia is a master; go because the experience she, her partners, and her staff will allow YOU to become the master of your experience. Don’t trust me on this, trust yourself to discover and delight in your own experience.
Definitely going to be one of the best bars in the city ....can't wait!!!!!
Cant wait!
